name: Semi-permanent mold (SPM) casting, aluminum
description:
No co-product allocation for scrap materials; all environmental flows for scrap are included in the environmental flows for the product. A percent difference is calculated in cases when 2 plants reported the same data point; the percent difference is calculated by dividing the difference between the 2 plants by the average of the 2 plants.
Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has 
undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet 
undergone a formal validation process.
Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: representative of current SPM casting technologies
processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.

exchanges.description: Average of 2 plants

This is the average of total aluminum inputs for 2 plants. There's a 13% difference between the 2 plants. Aluminum ingot includes a combination of 319 and 356 alloys. Weight of ingot includes alloying materials.
